Alberta.consumptionRules: Private property only, prohibited in vehicles and public spaces
Alberta.description: Alberta has a fully privatized cannabis retail system with over 700 licensed stores. The province allows the most retail licenses per capita in Canada, creating a competitive market with extensive consumer choice.

British Columbia.retailModel: Mixed - BC Cannabis Stores (government) + private retailers
British Columbia.consumptionRules: Private property only, prohibited in vehicles and areas where smoking/vaping tobacco is banned
British Columbia.description: BC operates both government-run BC Cannabis Stores and licensed private retailers. The province has a long cannabis culture history and hundreds of dispensaries across major cities like Vancouver and Victoria.

Manitoba.retailModel: Privatized - licensed by Liquor, Gaming and Cannabis Authority
Manitoba.consumptionRules: Private property only, prohibited in public and vehicles
Manitoba.description: Manitoba operates a private retail model but prohibits home cultivation. The province has licensed retailers primarily in Winnipeg and other major centers.

New Brunswick.consumptionRules: Private property only, prohibited in vehicles and public spaces
New Brunswick.description: Cannabis NB operates government-run stores across the province. All retail cannabis sales are through this Crown corporation, with locations in major cities like Moncton, Saint John, and Fredericton.

Newfoundland and Labrador.retailModel: Privatized - licensed by Cannabis Licensing Authority
Newfoundland and Labrador.consumptionRules: Private property only, prohibited in vehicles and public places
Newfoundland and Labrador.description: Newfoundland and Labrador operates a private retail system with stores primarily in St. John's and other population centers. The province licenses both physical stores and delivery services.

Northwest Territories.consumptionRules: Private property only, subject to community bylaws
Northwest Territories.description: The Northwest Territories has limited cannabis retail due to its small population and remote communities. Stores operate primarily in Yellowknife with online ordering available.

Nova Scotia.consumptionRules: Private property only, prohibited where tobacco smoking is banned
Nova Scotia.description: Nova Scotia Liquor Corporation operates NSLC Cannabis stores across the province. All legal cannabis sales are through these government-run locations in Halifax and other communities.

Nunavut.consumptionRules: Private property only, subject to community regulations
Nunavut.description: Nunavut does not have physical cannabis stores. Residents can purchase online through the territorial cannabis website with delivery across the territory.

Ontario.consumptionRules: Private property only, prohibited in vehicles and public spaces
Ontario.description: Ontario has Canada's largest cannabis retail market with over 1,500 licensed stores. The Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario (AGCO) regulates private retailers across major cities including Toronto, Ottawa, and Hamilton.

Prince Edward Island.consumptionRules: Private property only, prohibited in public and vehicles
Prince Edward Island.description: PEI operates both government-run Cannabis PEI stores and licensed private retailers. The small island province has stores in Charlottetown and other communities.

Quebec.retailModel: Government monopoly - SQDC (Société québécoise du cannabis)
Quebec.possessionLimits: 30 grams in public, 150 grams at home
Quebec.consumptionRules: Private property only, prohibited in vehicles and public spaces
Quebec.description: Quebec's SQDC operates government-run stores across the province. Cannabis retail is a provincial monopoly with locations in Montreal, Quebec City, and other major centers. Home cultivation is prohibited. Age requirement is 21+, higher than other provinces.

Saskatchewan.consumptionRules: Private property only, prohibited in vehicles and public
Saskatchewan.description: Saskatchewan operates a private retail model licensed by the Saskatchewan Liquor and Gaming Authority (SLGA). Stores operate across Saskatoon, Regina, and other communities.

Yukon.consumptionRules: Private property only, prohibited in public and vehicles
Yukon.description: Yukon has limited cannabis retail serving its small population. Stores operate in Whitehorse and select communities, with both government and private options available.
